title: Refraction - use v to relate n for blocks X and Y

content.question: Two transparent blocks, Block <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math> and Block <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math>, have indices of refraction <math alttext="n sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>n</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="n sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>n</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>, respectively. If light travels twice as fast in Block <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math> than it does in Block <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math>, what is <math alttext="n sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>n</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> in terms of <math alttext="n sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>n</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="one fourth n sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>n</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="one half n sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>n</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 1 over the square root of 2, end fraction, times n sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></mfrac><msub><mi>n</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="2 n sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>n</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="one half n sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>n</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
